p: But the only way to flatten epidemic curves without also affecting the areas beneath them – as some figures in the media have suggested – is to change the mean interval between being infected and infecting others, or generation time. The pathogenesis of infectious diseases typically is characterized by replication prior to dissemination [6], so that people are not infectious for a while after being infected, called the latent period. Suppose – for sake of argument – that we could modify this period ( Fig. 2).
